page.title: 12MARKET BOSWORTH PARK
page.content:
The park comprises approximately 0.35 sq.km. of open parkland and is situated on the eastern approach to the town of Market Bosworth.
Purchased in 1970 by Leicestershire County Council, the park had previously formed part of the grounds of Bosworth Hall, home, since the late 16th century of the Dixie family. The park is open to the public during daylight hours and a car park and picnic area is provided.
At the southern extent of the park is an arboretum, consisting of a wide variety of Maples, Oaks, Alders and Willows. In the midst of the arboretum lies an extensive lake, well stocked with fish and with daily fishing permits available from the baliff.
